item.title: Etienette add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "Life is a disease: sexually transmitted, and invariably fatal." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Etienette add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "Most books on witchcraft will tell you that witches work naked. This is because most books on witchcraft were written by men." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Etienette add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "Things need not have happened to be true. Tales and dreams are the shadow-truths that will endure when mere facts are dust and ashes, and forgot." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Etienette add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "When I was a child, adults would tell me not to make things up, warning me of what would happen if I did. As far as I can tell so far, it seems to involve lots of foreign travel and not having to get up too early in the morning." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Etienette add a quote by Albert Camus
item.description: "In the depth of winter, I finally learned that within me there lay an invincible summer." -- Albert Camus

item.title: Etienette add a quote by Albert Camus
item.description: "Live to the point of tears." -- Albert Camus

item.title: Etienette add a quote by Albert Camus
item.description: "You know what charm is: a way of getting the answer yes without having asked any clear question." -- Albert Camus

item.title: Etienette add a quote by Albert Camus
item.description: "I have no idea what's awaiting me, or what will happen when this all ends. For the moment I know this: there are sick people and they need curing." -- Albert Camus

item.title: Etienette add a quote by Albert Camus
item.description: "A man's work is nothing but this slow trek to rediscover, through the detours of art, those two or three great and simple images in whose presence his heart first opened." -- Albert Camus

item.title: Etienette add a quote by Albert Camus
item.description: "Idleness is fatal only to the mediocre." -- Albert Camus

item.title: Etienette add a quote by Albert Camus
item.description: "At the heart of all beauty lies something inhuman." -- Albert Camus

item.title: Etienette add a quote by Albert Camus
item.description: "Man is always prey to his truths. Once he has admitted them, he cannot free himself from them." -- Albert Camus

item.title: Etienette add a quote by Patricia A. McKillip
item.description: "The man was hit in one eye by a stone, and that eye turned inward so that it looked into his mind, and he died of what he saw there" -- Patricia A. McKillip

item.title: Etienette add a quote by Anaïs Nin
item.description: "I, with a deeper instinct, choose a man who compels my strength, who makes enormous demands on me, who does not doubt my courage or my toughness, who does not believe me naïve or innocent, who has the courage to treat me like a woman." -- Anaïs Nin

item.title: Etienette add a quote by Anais Nin
item.description: "And the day came when the risk to remain tight in a bud was more painful than the risk it took to blossom." -- Anais Nin

item.title: Etienette add a quote by Anais Nin
item.description: "Each friend represents a world in us, a world possibly not born until they arrive, and it is only by this meeting that a new world is born." -- Anais Nin

item.title: Etienette add a quote by Anais Nin
item.description: "Luxury is not a necessity to me, but beautiful and good things are." -- Anais Nin

item.title: Etienette add a quote by Anais Nin
item.description: "How wrong is it for a woman to expect the man to build the world she wants, rather than to create it herself?" -- Anais Nin

item.title: Etienette add a quote by Anais Nin
item.description: "I am only responsible for my own heart, you offered yours up for the smashing my darling. Only a fool would give out such a vital organ" -- Anais Nin

item.title: Etienette add a quote by Paulo Coelho
item.description: "It's the possibility of having a dream come true that makes life interesting." -- Paulo Coelho

item.title: Etienette add a quote by Barbara Ehrenreich
item.description: "Of all the nasty outcomes predicted for women's liberation...none was more alarming than the suggestion that women would eventually become just like men." -- Barbara Ehrenreich

item.title: Etienette add a quote by Robert A. Heinlein
item.description: "A human being should be able to change a diaper, plan an invasion, butcher a hog, conn a ship, design a building, write a sonnet, balance accounts, build a wall, set a bone, comfort the dying, take orders, give orders, cooperate, act alone, solve equations, analyze a new problem, pitch manure, program a computer, cook a tasty meal, fight efficiently, die gallantly. Specialization is for insects." -- Robert A. Heinlein

item.title: Etienette add a quote by charles de lint
item.description: "Every time you do a good deed you shine the light a little farther into the dark. And the thing is, when you're gone that light is going to keep shining on, pushing the shadows back." -- charles de lint

item.title: Etienette add a quote by Charles de Lint
item.description: "People want to know those details. They think it gives them greater insight into a piece of art, but when they approach a painting in such a manner, they are belittling both the artist’s work and their own ability to experience it. Each painting I do says everything I want to say on its subject and in terms of that painting, and not all the trivia in the world concerning my private life will give the viewer more insight into it than what hangs there before their eyes. Frankly, as far as I’m concerned, even titling a work is an unnecessary concession." -- Charles de Lint

item.title: Etienette add a quote by Richard Bach
item.description: "Every person, all the events of your life are there because you have drawn them there. What you choose to do with them is up to you." -- Richard Bach

item.title: Etienette add a quote by Richard Bach
item.description: "The bond that links your true family is not one of blood, but of respect and joy in each other's life. Rarely do members of one family grow up under the same roof." -- Richard Bach

item.title: Etienette add a quote by Richard Bach
item.description: "That’s what learning is, after all; not whether we lose the game, but how we lose and how we’ve changed because of it, and what we take away from it that we never had before, to apply to other games. Losing, in a curious way is winning." -- Richard Bach

item.title: Etienette add a quote by Richard Bach
item.description: "Bad things are not the worst things that an happen to us. NOTHING is the worst thing that can happen to us." -- Richard Bach

item.title: Etienette add a quote by Richard Bach
item.description: "I do not exist to impress the world. I exist to live my life in a way that will make me happy. " -- Richard Bach

item.title: Etienette add a quote by Richard Bach
item.description: "If your happiness depends on what somebody else does, I guess you do have a problem." -- Richard Bach
